Consultant â€” PricewaterhouseCoopers

Led technical requirement gathering and oversaw the design and implementation of a Medicare Stars data mart and cube
Facilitated data mapping through SQL queries, and contributed to the design of the relational database schema composed of fourteen datasets for the data mart

Advised a large pharmaceutical benefit manager on implementing program governance models, enhancing operational efficiencies crucial for securing capital funding
Coordinated the transition of an in-flight program to an agile delivery model by managing three program managers across four workstreams to help technology and product teams execute on the roadmap

title: About Me
text: Adam Stein is a recent Masterâ€™s student in Data Science & Analytics at Georgetown University with a Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering from Washington University in St.Â Louis. He brings three years of professional experience as a consultant (PwC), leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills to drive impactful solutions. His academic and professional interests include machine learning, large language models (LLMs), and artificial intelligence, where he is passionate about exploring innovative applications and driving technological advancements.
